Message.Title: Yahoo! Sports is coming to your TV
Message.Msg: Yahoo! Inc and NBC Sports Group said they will integrate and promote each others sports content on the Internet as well as on television in a move that would help both the companies draw on their respective strengths across both mediums. The collaboration will increase NBC's digital presence as well as bolster its college and fantasy game coverage, while Yahoo will gain access NBC's video content, live sports coverage and big name television personalities. Reuters-

Message.Title: Bet on the Coal Sector, not the NG Sector
Message.Msg: There is no question that both natural gas price and coal price is going a lot higher. But the coal sector, being deeply discounted, is where you will make the big profits. Coal price has just raised to the profitability threshold of coal producers. But natural gas remains deeply un-profitable for shale gas producers. Not to mention that the NG sector has a combined debt load of more than HALF A TRILLION DOLLARS. Not to mention that both the coal and the NG sector produces about an equal amount of energy, but yet investors put 75 times more capital money in the NG sector versus the coal sector. It was the biggest misplacement of investment in the history of energy investment. This create a huge buying opportunity in the US coal sector. Buy JRCC, ANR, ACI, BTU, WLT.

Topic.Title: Pick the date that Yahoo will hit $20
Apple is going to go after Yahoo and take on Google. It's called Operation: Level the playing field.

Message.Msg: Why would Apple go after Yahoo to take on Google? What has Yahoo got that Apple could use against Google? Search is out since Microsoft owns the search engine Yahoo uses. Yahoo mail, Apple´s own iCloud Mail is already more popular than Yahoo mail. And is there enough money in free email to make Apple go for Yahoo anyway? Software, Apple and Google compete on mobile operating systems. Yahoo has no mobile operating system. I can’t picture Apple, a hardware company, buying Yahoo, a glorified web portal, to compete with Google, a search company. To me it sounds like Pepsi buying Starbucks to compete with McDonalds, Operation: Let´s do something expensive and pointless.
